instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.ISL6258: What is ISL6258? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2008 through 2009.
definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ADAPTER_SENSE: What is ADAPTER_SENSE? This is a line between the onewire circuit and the magsafe charger where the magsafe charger can talk to the SMC(system management controller) on the SYS_ONEWIRE line..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> vs <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP>
threads.message:
Hi 2 Informaticos, team,

I have this board on which they claimed had a WD but I didn't found any corrosion anywhere......
as this board is old I checked the resistance of pp3v42 to GND to make sure this is not a bad MCP failure: 0.8M Ohms: OK

[B]<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>:8.17V [/B]
pp3v42: 3.42V

at <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>:
R17/18: 20.8Ohms
R27/28: 20.5 Ohms OK
But what is weird in my case is that I have an [B]<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> mounted instead of <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP>[/B]
Board is turning ON on battery with ppbus 11.55V and the charger light turns green, once the battery is removed I can turn it ON/OFF by triggering <RESISTOR>R5015</RESISTOR>/16

On charger only, it turns in SMC bypass mode.
When the board is ON, the fan spins to the max speed like I have a Current/Voltage sensing issue.......
Reflowed SMC still the same

Question: Could that happen that on this boards they mounted <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> or is it a mistake on borad or schematics?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> vs <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP>
threads.message:
Replaced <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> by <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP>:
[B]PPBUS: 12.58V[/B]
But the board still has the same behiour: turns ON only on Battery or battery and charger both together.
I would say, that if it's charging the battery, it's fine as the battery is supposed to always be installed......I have to check this current/voltage sensing issue as the fan still runs fast......

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> vs <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP>
threads.message:
I've fotgotten to say that
on pin 5 of the magesafe  <SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL> I have 3.412V but no green light ( I've just had the green light once since what it disapeared )
I'm using official 85W charger....also tried with a 60W official charger and lab power supply with official 85W magsafe cord.

I've replaced the small magesafe connector and had the green light and the bord is turning ON.
After checking and mesuring I've found that on this small connector one resistor on the <SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL> line which was supposed to be 22 Ohm was reading severals KOhms, I've replaced it.
tested the connector again: green light OK and board is turning ON.

but still fan running fast.....

I'll reassemble everything and test

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> vs <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP>
threads.message:
Run corresponding ASD EFI version and see which error pops out.
Usually is sign of bad trackpad board/flex.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> vs <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP>
threads.message:
Hi 2Informaticos,

Once back in the chassis, everything was OK , except the keyboard because of the WD.
When Ishorted Pin 5 of J5713 the machine turns ON/OFF so need also to replace keyboard........
was a good troubleshoot........
You still have no idea why I had a 6259 instead of 6258 on that board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> vs <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP>
threads.message: Because someone else messed up with the board before you...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> vs <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP>
threads.message:

As usual it's a plaisure working with you......
